hackathon-description-text: RevolutionUC is a student hackathon in which we invite students from across the midwest to partake in a weekend of code, community, and self-improvement. You don't have to attend the University of Cincinnati and you don't have to be a computer science major or engineering student. We're looking for people who share our passion to do awesome things with technology.
hackathon-eligibility:
RevolutionUC is open to all college and high school students. Before any hacking begins we require you to sign a waiver, which will be emailed to all registered participants prior to the hackathon. If you are under 18 you will need a parent or legal guardian to sign the waiver.
View the FAQ page on the event's website (
hackathon-requirements:
Submissions open as soon as hacking starts, at 2:30 pm  on April 8th, and end when hacking ends, at 2:30 pm on April 9th. You must submit before 1:00 pm on April 9th in order to be eligible for judging. You can and are encouraged to continue working on your project until hacking ends (2:30 pm on April 9th).
You may use your own laptop for your presentation. Projects will be evaluated in an exposition style by different judges who will visit your group if you submit your project. The top teams will present their project during the closing ceremonies.

Finalists will have access to a mini-display port, VGA hookups, an HDMI cable, a computer with a web browser, and a document camera for their presentations. These presentations will determine the overall 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place projects.
In addition to overall 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place, we also offer sponsor prizes and category prizes that will be judged separately.
hackathon-rules: RevolutionUC follows the Hack Code of Conduct, as well as the MLH Code of Conduct. For more information please visit the following sources for these rules:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The overall winner of the competition will receive a
The team that places second will receive Bose Noise Canceling Headphones. Each person on the team (up to 4 people) will receive headphones. There will also be a second placemedal
The team that places third overall will receive a Google Home. Each person on the team (up to 4 people) will receive a Google Home. There will also be a third place medal.
The most popular hack will be awarded to the team with the most votes on Devpost. Each person on the team (up to 4 people) will receive a Fitbit Charge.
Any team of only high school students is eligible for this prize. Each member of the team (up to 4 people) with the best hack will receive a Raspberry Pi Kit.
The team with the best User Interface presented during judging will receive Bluetooth speaker. Each person on the team (up to 4 people) will receive a speaker.
Tata Consultancy Services will give $250 Amazon gift cards to winners of their best hardware hack prize.

Kinetic Vision and Helium challenge students to use the Helium IoT Developer Platform to design, build and deploy an innovative sensing solution. Helium Development Kits and a range of sensors will be available for use during the Hackathon. Free Helium Development Kits will be awarded to the Winners for Best Helium IoT Hack.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Kinetic Vision Best Overall Helium IoT Hack First Place

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Kinetic Vision and Helium challenge students to use the Helium IoT Developer Platform to design, build and deploy an innovative sensing solution. Helium Development Kits and a range of sensors will be available for use during the Hackathon. Second place will receive a Raspberry Pi Zero W.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Kinetic Vision Best Overall Helium IoT Hack Second Place

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: IBM is offering prizes to the top 3 teams who complete their challenge: "Best use of Watson IoT Platform on Bluemix." The 1st place winners will receive an Apple iWatch Series 2.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: IBM Best Use of Watson IoT Platform on Bluemix First Place

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: BM is offering prizes to the top 3 teams who complete their challenge: "Best use of Watson IoT Platform on Bluemix." 2nd place will receive a Raspberry Pi 3 with Sense HAT.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: IBM Best Use of Watson IoT Platform on Bluemix Second Place

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: BM is offering prizes to the top 3 teams who complete their challenge: "Best use of Watson IoT Platform on Bluemix." 3rd place will receive a Raspberry Pi 3.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: IBM Best Use of Watson IoT Platform on Bluemix ThirdPlace

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The team that wins best media hack will win a day with Scripps CTO.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=2600 Clifton Ave, Cincinnati, OH 45220, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How did your team innovate or use new methods to develop your solution?

What new technologies did your group learn from this activity?
Did you learn more about tools you've previously used?
How did this project improve your skills as a programmer/engineer?
What does your project do and how well does it perform?
